title: Fix blank page rendering issue in production

requirements.text: Investigate and fix the root cause of the blank page in production by checking for runtime errors in the React application, ensuring all imports and dependencies are correctly resolved, and verifying that the root element mounting in frontend/src/main.tsx is working properly
acceptanceCriteria: The homepage renders successfully with all sections visible
The admin dashboard is accessible and renders correctly
No JavaScript errors appear in the browser console
The React application mounts to the DOM without errors

requirements.text: Verify that frontend/src/App.tsx correctly configures TanStack Router with both the home (/) and admin (/admin) routes and that the RouterProvider is properly wrapped with QueryClientProvider
acceptanceCriteria: Both routes render their respective page components
Navigation between routes works without errors
QueryClient context is available to all components

requirements.text: Ensure all component imports in frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx and frontend/src/pages/AdminDashboard.tsx resolve correctly and that no circular dependencies or missing modules cause the application to fail
acceptanceCriteria: All section components import and render without errors
All admin dashboard components import and render without errors
No module resolution errors in the build output

requirements.text: Verify that the backend actor initialization in frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts completes successfully and does not block the application from rendering if the actor creation fails or is pending
acceptanceCriteria: Application renders even if backend actor is not yet initialized
Loading states are properly handled in components that depend on the actor
Error boundaries catch and handle actor initialization failures gracefully

requirements.text: Add error boundary component to catch and display React rendering errors instead of showing a blank page, with a user-friendly error message and option to reload the page
acceptanceCriteria: Error boundary wraps the main application in frontend/src/App.tsx
When a component error occurs, a fallback UI displays instead of a blank page
Error details are logged to the console for debugging
Users can see a friendly error message in both Hindi and English

constraints: Do not modify the backend actor structure or data models
Preserve all existing functionality for admin dashboard and member registration
Do not change paths listed in frontend.immutablePaths
nonGoals: Adding new features or sections to the website
Changing the visual design or theme
Modifying backend API methods or data structures
